result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas W McKeown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas W McKeown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas W McKeown was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

Upon recommendation that the defendant be terminated from the Bail Monitoring Program, court ordered Arrest Warrant be issued and once in custody, defendant's cash bail be reinstated in the amt of $1000 per case, for a total of $1000. All other previous bail conditions remain set.  Arrest warrant issued.  Original and copy of warrant to DCSO.  Copy for file.
